name: DefeatBordeaux
_source: speak;Morrissey;Once you've taken some time to rest, please join me.{w}{br}I would love to discuss our partnership in further detail.
speak;Luther;It seems we passed with flying colors.{w}{br}This bodes well for us.
speak;Morrissey;I must say Lord Verstadt, you exceeded every expectation.{w}{br}I am overjoyed to have a friend in you and your house.{w}{br}Now, first, a gift as a gesture of goodwill.
# Feel free to change this later, but some money for now
speak;Simon;Thank you, Lord Morrissey. We will use this wisely.
speak;Morrissey;I have no doubt.{w} Now, I'd like to discuss our next steps.
speak;Morrissey;As of late, this continent has known nothing but chaos.{w}{br}We nobles are losing control of our own land.{w}{br}Some groups seek a world without us.
speak;Morrissey;Worst of all, our own king seems ambivalent to our plight.
speak;Simon;Agreed, on all counts.{w} My primary concern, though, is my home.
speak;Morrissey;As it should be.{w} In regards to that problem,{w}{br}I regret that neither of us have the army needed to defeat the New Dawn.
speak;Morrissey;My humble advice is to, for now, sidestep your concerns.{w}{br}We can begin to forge alliances with other powers,{w}{br}and eventually raise an army capable of taking back your home.
speak;Morrissey;Port Hull is my primary focus.
speak;Morrissey;Their stranglehold on trade threatens both our economies.{w}{br}I have here a letter for them.
speak;Morrissey;Negotiating the deal within it is paramount to success.
speak;Morrissey;I also expect that my daughter will accompany you.{w}{br}As my heir, she will represent the interests of my House.
speak;Morrissey;Now, your travels should be as grandiose as possible.{w}{br}Make your station and mission clear.{w}{br}Every person you meet should feel awed by your presence.
speak;Simon;We'd be the obvious target of any assassins or thieves.{w}{br}Something more subtle, like a mercenary group, could be better.
speak;Mercenary1;Death to Morrissey! Death to the tyrants!
speak;Mercenary1;Death to Morrissey! Death to the tyrants!
speak;SoldierBlue;I-intruders! Spread out and lock down the castle!
speak;Morrissey;It seems I now owe you my life.
speak;Morrissey;Yet another reason to be thankful for our alliance.
speak;Simon;It was nothing.{w} Now, is there anything else?
speak;Morrissey;Not for you to be concerned over.
speak;Morrissey;It seems I must investigate how a brigand strolled into my hall.{w}{br}I apologize, but I must take my leave.
speak;Luther;You moved... quickly against that assassin.
speak;Luther;I do not doubt your reflexes, but you parried his swing before he made it.{w}{br}How?
speak;Simon;This happened as we were escaping the castle, too.{w}{br}My death was... nullified.{w}{br}Both times, I heard a voice as it happened.
speak;Simon;I am not a madman Luther, I swear.
speak;Luther;I believe you, though others might not.
speak;Luther;Perhaps you have been granted the blessing of the Fates.
speak;Simon;The Fates? Why would they bless me?
speak;Luther;Who can say.{w} The will of a god is not easily understood.
speak;Simon;It is a useful tool, either way.{w}{br}Immortality is a powerful gift.

speak;Luther;Invincibility.{w} And it is only apparent invincibility.{w}{br}No god can revoke their blessing, but using it rashly can incur their wrath.{w}{br}I know of a shrine to one of the Fates nearby.{w}{br}Perhaps visiting there could yield answers.
